chapter.title: Circulation
chapter.para: The circulation system of a library means the management of the library's holdings in terms of copies of documents and making them available to the readers. We often refer to the latter as the charging system.
The side menu of the circulation tab shows 5 headings : Circulation, Display items, Holds, Reminders and Suggestions.
Circulation is for managing readers and loans.
Display retrieves information about the library collection.
Holds allows you to manage holds placed on works available in the library by readers.

Reminders corresponds to sending overdue notices to readers for items unreturned by the due date and the recoveries to effect. This sub-menu is available only if the financial management of readers is enabled, for more details consult the Administrator's guide, section Financial management.
Suggestions orders to offer staff and readers the possibility to make suggestions for acquisition.

sect2.title: Loans
sect2.para: Lending out items to borrowers is very simple : you only have to enter the barcode of the reader from his membership card followed by the item barcode or accession number. Of course the same transaction can be carried out fully using a barcode reader which very conveniently replaces the manual entry of the barcode and "enter" on the keyboard.
Obviously there must already be some items and borrowers present in the database to allow for issues to be effected.

sect3.title: Borrower Search
sect3.para: A borrower search works like this: whenever you click on the Circulation tab the following screen appears. Enter the full name of the borrower or part of it in the text box and press Enter. Of course you can also read his barcode ID on his borrower's card with your scanner to display his file.
To display the complete list of borrowers leave the text box empty and press Enter. From there you can pick and choose any particular user.

sect3.title: Search results
sect3.para: Example. Let's lend out Rwanda : a people with a history, by C. M. Overdulve, to our borrower Luke Skywalker (with barcode n° 100003).
His barcode is entered or read by the barcode reader to identify the borrower.
We can also enter all or part of the borrower's name in order to select him from a list. For now we will enter the letter "s" for Skywalker.

figure.title: Circulation > Loan (results of a borrower search)

sect3.para: Click on borrower Skywalker in the search results list.

sect3.title: Borrower's card
sect3.para: The barcode of a copy of the Rwanda title is 33700003286792.
Just enter this barcode in the "new loan" field to effect the loan issue. Press Enter to validate the issue. The loan has been added to the list of current loans.

You can then cancel the loan on the fly by clicking on cancel (in this case, the loan is not taken into account for the statistics contrary to a validated loan issue immediately followed by a return).

You can also print a loan ticket. It takes the form of a PDF file generated by PMB. On Windows the "print loan ticket" button calls the Acrobat reader plugin and displays a loan ticket ready to print detailing the borrower, the item loaned and the date of return. You only have to click on the Acrobat print icon to print the loan ticket.
Starting the Acrobat reader to view the loan ticket can sometimes take rather long depending on your computer. In this case either be patient or start Acrobat well in advance.
Note. If your item has a particular status that does not allow lending, but this rule can be overridden, PMB will ask you if you want to force the loan or not.

figure.title: Item is excluded from loan: option to force the loan

sect3.para: In our example, the library parameters (name, address, logo) are those of the Bueil Library. These parameters can be customized in the administration tab. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Tools section.
Other available functions from the reader's file:

listitem.para: Effecting an express loan

Express loan button
The express loan enables you to loan items that are still in cataloguing. Click on "express loan" to enter the information necessary to issue an item that has not yet been catalogued.

Express loan
Enter Title and ISBN. Indicate a media type (to be able to manage loan periods and quotas consequently).
Then scan your item barcode, or enter it and validate.
You may afterwards recall the record to complete its cataloguing.
Updating borrower data (including membership renewal), see Adding a borrower, later in this document.
To update borrower data, click on the Edit button.
Extending an existing loan
To extend a loan, click on the Due button. In the calendar popup, select the new due date. In this popup, use the arrows to move forward or backward for months, and the double arrows for years.

figure.title: Date selection Popup for extending a loan

listitem.para: Extending all loans on the fly. Click on the button + to select all, then click on the date button "Extend loans of checked items until".
Deleting a borrower: possible only if the borrower has no current loans. If there are current loans, the items must be returned first.
Printing the loans records: Click on Print to print the list of borrowed items and current holds, click on Loans list to print the current loans for borrower.
Printing the borrower's card
Adding a new borrower
The add button next to Holds at the bottom allows reserve an item.
After clicking on Add, carry out a search. When the item to be placed on hold is found, click on its title to insert it into the list of holds.

sect3.title: Borrower's file with Financial management enabled
sect3.para: Enabling financial management displays the borrower's library accounts (membership, loans and fines) underneath his personal data.
If you don't see these three accounts it means financial management of readers has not been enabled. For more details, consult the Administrator's Guide of PMB, chapter Financial management.

Reader's file showing the membership, loans and fines accounts
For more details on the financial management of readers, go to the section Loans and financial management further down.

sect2.title: Return items
sect2.para: Scan the barcode of the item being returned. The borrower card is not required.
A confirmation message is displayed to allow you to check that the barcode does correspond to the item being returned.

figure.title: Circulation > Return items, confirmation of a processed return

sect2.para: This display gives the borrower name that returned the item. Following this is a link which allows access to the relevant borrower file, which can be used, for example, to issue new loans.
Also displayed are:

listitem.para: the item type, location, class mark and other copy details
If the return is overdue, the number of days late
The name of the borrower who had the item on loan
If entered, any message associated with the item
Any pending holds

sect2.title: Borrower Groups
sect2.para: The Borrower groups functionality allows PMB to be used by librarians who wish to manage their borrowers by groups: classes, familles, etc.

sect3.title: Barcode for the new borrower
sect3.para: A borrower barcode is required whenever you want to create a new borrower. If the pmb.num_carte_auto parameter is active (has a value of 1), PMB will suggest a new borrower barcode equivalant to the highest barcode in the database +1.
For more information about the PMB parameters, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Utils section.
Once a borrower card number has been defined, click to reach the data entry screen for new borrower information.
Note: Validation (Click on the next button) is automatic with a barcode reader.

sect3.title: Enter the borrower data
sect3.para: You can enter the personal information about the borrower on this screen.

If personnalisable fields were defined in Administration > Bororwers > Personalisable Parameters, they will be visible at the bottom of the borrower file. On the following screen, you can complete the required personalisable parameters. To enter a different barcode, replace with the barcode of your choice or rescan the new barcode.
If you enter a barcode which is already allocated, PMB will give you an error message.
To ntoe :

listitem.para: A surname must always be entered
A forename must always be entered

The date of birth is not mandatory if the parameter empr.birthdate_optional is selected (has a value of 1). For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Utils chapter, Parameters section.

The fields OPAC ID and OPAC password define the login ID the borrower can use in the OPAC (normally situated at the left of the screen). If these fields are not edited before creation of the borrower, they willhave the following values by default :
for the ID : First letter of forename + surname.
for the password: year of birth (yyyy) if it is entered, otherwise 0.

the possible personalised fields are displayed at the end of the borrower file. They allow you to add all types of information to a borrower file. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Borrowers chapter.

sect2.title: Copy by barcode
sect2.para: Enter a barcode to display the information about the corresponding copy.

Circulation > Display > Copy by barcode ; results screen

sect2.title: Item by author/title
sect2.para: You will see here a screen which works like the search section in the catalogue. (See later on the Catalogue chapter). You can enter a title or an author as the starting point of your search.
Truncations are usable here, using regular expressions. To obtain more information about this subject, click on the link "regular expressions".
You can also search for an item by it's ISBN, it's commerce number (EAN), or as above, by it's copy number.

sect1.title: Holds
sect1.para: PMB allows the placing of hold requests on items for a borrower. Holds are available in the circulation tab in a borrower file (item loans) and, depending on the parameterisation, within the OPAC, from the borrower file. (For more information about parameterising the OPAC, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide.)
Advanced hold management is available from PMB version 1.3 onwards.

sect2.title: in progress
sect2.para: In this screen, current holds are displayed. The rank within the file is specified if many borrowers have held the same item.

The holds are inserted as unvalidated. Once a hold has been added, the person responsible for the holds finds the corresponding items on the shelves, and holds (that is puts aside) these items. To edit the list of items to retrieve from the shelves, in the Editions tab, click on the menu item holds to process. (For more information, see ).
The barcodes of the items which then put aside are scanned. The holds are then "validated".
If you wish to delete a hold, Click the Delete option, then click on the button Validate the deletions.
You can print the relevant hold confirmation letters. To do this, click on the button Confirmation Letters

sect2.title: Expired
sect2.para: The screen of expired holds lists the holds which were not cancelled and for which the valid until date is past. You must therefore delete them. To delete a hold, select the Delete option then click on the button Validate the deletions.
You can, if you wish, leave additional time even with expired holds. In this case, do not delete the expired holds, until after the end of the extra time.

sect2.title: Items to shelve
sect2.para: The list of items to shelve contains held documents, which have normally been removed from the shelves and held with the borrower name, and then the hold was deleted. The holds are placed, in most cases, at the library reception counter; "items to shelve" allows you to take stock of the times which must be reshelved.
